intro: Sulla, commonly known as greater celandine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and rhizomatous growth habit. The plant contains various alkaloids, including chelidonium, which contribute to its medicinal and toxic properties. Sulla has lobed leaves that are often hairy and can grow up to 30 cm in length. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks.
